page.title: Human rights in Egypt under the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces

Line 18: Line 18:
Another Activist the has been detained is Loai Nagati.<ref name="ahram3">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/15393/Egypt/Politics-/Loai-Nagati-another-Egyptian-activist-to-face-mili.aspx |title=Loai Nagati: another Egyptian activist to face military trial - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref> [[We are all Khaled Said|We Are All Khaled Said]] facebook page wrote: "Loai Nagati is a 21 years old Egyptian Activist who got arrested during Tahrir protests yesterday morning. As it has become the norm now, Loai has been sent to 15 days in a military jail awaiting a military investigation! Loai didnât have a lawyer, has no clear accusation against him & is a computer science student. He is a civilian & shouldnât be investigated by military prosecuters. End military trials of civilians in Egypt NOW! 45 protesters have been arrested so far during Tahrir protests on 28 June night & 29 June morning. All sent to military trials."<ref>{{cite web|title=Loai Nagati is a 21 years old Egyptian Activist|url=http://liveword.ca/egypt/2011/06/30/24076/|publisher=http://liveword.ca/|accessdate=2 July 2011}}</ref> An active tweeter, Nagati was tweeting (@LoaiNagati) from Tahrir Square about what was taking place when he was arrested. âSeveral people are injured,â was the last tweet by Nagati at 7am on Wednesday.<ref name="ahram3">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/15393/Egypt/Politics-/Loai-Nagati-another-Egyptian-activist-to-face-mili.aspx |title=Loai Nagati: another Egyptian activist to face military trial - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref> Nagati is to be detained for 15 days and was transferred on June 29 to military prison pending a military trial.<ref name="elbadil1">{{cite news|title=Ø´ÙÙÙ ÙØ¤Ù ÙØ¬Ø§ØªÙ ÙØ¹ØªÙÙ Ø§ÙØ³Ø¬Ù Ø§ÙØ­Ø±Ø¨Ù Ø§ÙÙØ±ÙØ¶ Ø¨Ø§ÙÙÙØ¨: ÙÙØ¹ÙÙÙ ÙÙ Ø¥Ø¯Ø®Ø§Ù Ø£Ø¯ÙÙØ© ÙÙ ÙØ·Ø§ÙØ¨ØªÙÙ Ø¨Ø§ÙÙØ¨Ø¶ Ø¹ÙÙ ÙØ£Ø¯Ø®Ù Ø§ÙØ¯ÙØ§Ø¡|url=http://elbadil.net/%D8%B4%D9%82%D9%8A%D9%82-%D9%84%D8%A4%D9%8A-%D9%86%D8%AC%D8%A7%D8%AA%D9%8A-%D9%85%D8%B9%D8%AA%D9%82%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B3%D8%AC%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AD%D8%B1%D8%A8%D9%8A-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%B1/|accessdate=2 July 2011|newspaper=http://elbadil.net/|date=1 July 2011}}</ref> Nagati has a heart condition as well as digestive problems which require 10 different medications, and after some struggle, an officer who works at the prison agreed to the the medication to Nagati.<ref name="elbadil1"/>
Another Activist the has been detained is Loai Nagati.<ref name="ahram3">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/15393/Egypt/Politics-/Loai-Nagati-another-Egyptian-activist-to-face-mili.aspx |title=Loai Nagati: another Egyptian activist to face military trial - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref> [[We are all Khaled Said|We Are All Khaled Said]] facebook page wrote: "Loai Nagati is a 21 years old Egyptian Activist who got arrested during Tahrir protests yesterday morning. As it has become the norm now, Loai has been sent to 15 days in a military jail awaiting a military investigation! Loai didnât have a lawyer, has no clear accusation against him & is a computer science student. He is a civilian & shouldnât be investigated by military prosecuters. End military trials of civilians in Egypt NOW! 45 protesters have been arrested so far during Tahrir protests on 28 June night & 29 June morning. All sent to military trials."<ref>{{cite web|title=Loai Nagati is a 21 years old Egyptian Activist|url=http://liveword.ca/egypt/2011/06/30/24076/|publisher=http://liveword.ca/|accessdate=2 July 2011}}</ref> An active tweeter, Nagati was tweeting (@LoaiNagati) from Tahrir Square about what was taking place when he was arrested. âSeveral people are injured,â was the last tweet by Nagati at 7am on Wednesday.<ref name="ahram3">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/15393/Egypt/Politics-/Loai-Nagati-another-Egyptian-activist-to-face-mili.aspx |title=Loai Nagati: another Egyptian activist to face military trial - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref> Nagati is to be detained for 15 days and was transferred on June 29 to military prison pending a military trial.<ref name="elbadil1">{{cite news|title=Ø´ÙÙÙ ÙØ¤Ù ÙØ¬Ø§ØªÙ ÙØ¹ØªÙÙ Ø§ÙØ³Ø¬Ù Ø§ÙØ­Ø±Ø¨Ù Ø§ÙÙØ±ÙØ¶ Ø¨Ø§ÙÙÙØ¨: ÙÙØ¹ÙÙÙ ÙÙ Ø¥Ø¯Ø®Ø§Ù Ø£Ø¯ÙÙØ© ÙÙ ÙØ·Ø§ÙØ¨ØªÙÙ Ø¨Ø§ÙÙØ¨Ø¶ Ø¹ÙÙ ÙØ£Ø¯Ø®Ù Ø§ÙØ¯ÙØ§Ø¡|url=http://elbadil.net/%D8%B4%D9%82%D9%8A%D9%82-%D9%84%D8%A4%D9%8A-%D9%86%D8%AC%D8%A7%D8%AA%D9%8A-%D9%85%D8%B9%D8%AA%D9%82%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B3%D8%AC%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AD%D8%B1%D8%A8%D9%8A-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%B1/|accessdate=2 July 2011|newspaper=http://elbadil.net/|date=1 July 2011}}</ref> Nagati has a heart condition as well as digestive problems which require 10 different medications, and after some struggle, an officer who works at the prison agreed to the the medication to Nagati.<ref name="elbadil1"/>
â   â
==Murder==
  â
Ramy Fakhry,<ref name="ahram2"/> 27-year-old electrical engineer, was killed by the army.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/12289/Egypt/Politics-/Candlelight-vigil-for-Egyptian-shot-by-army-asks-W.aspx |title=Candlelight vigil for Egyptian shot by army asks 'Why was Ramy killed?' |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> He died as a result of bullet wounds received at an army checkpoint somewhere in the governorate of Damietta. The checkpointâs exact location is unknown.<ref name="thedailynewsegypt1">{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailynewsegypt.com/crime-a-accidents/family-of-man-killed-at-checkpoint-demands-investigation.html |title=Family of man killed at checkpoint demands investigation |publisher=www.thedailynewsegypt.com|date=2011-05-15 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> According to one, unconfirmed, version of events, Fakhry stopped his car just short of the checkpoint when he saw a gunfight between the army and assailants ahead of him and was shot three times in the back as he attempted to drive away.<ref name="thedailynewsegypt1"/> Another version of the story says he left the rig where he worked near Damietta on Friday 13 May to attend a wedding. On his way back later that night at 1am â before the curfew imposed at the time â Fakhry was shot dead at an army checkpoint.<ref name="ahram2">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/14715/Egypt/Politics-/Activists-and-friends-seek-answers-over-Ramy-Fakhr.aspx |title=Activists and friends seek answers over Ramy Fakhryâs death|publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-06-21 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> A candlelight vigil was organized by Ramy's family and friends on May 14th, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arabawy.org/2011/05/17/tribute-to-ramy-fakhry-%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%85%D9%8A-%D9%81%D8%AE%D8%B1%D9%8A/ |title=Tribute to Ramy Fakhry 3|publisher=www.arabawy.org|date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> Head of the Supreme Council for Armed Force (SCAF), Field Marshal Hussein Tantawi, ordered an investigation into the killing of Ramy Fakhry.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailynewsegypt.com/people/following-vigil-scaf-orders-investigation-into-army-shooting-of-engineer.html |title=Following vigil, SCAF orders investigation into army shooting of engineer |publisher=www.thedailynewsegypt.com|date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> The statement has not been followed with any updates concerning the investigation, prompting the call for action.<ref name="ahram2"/>
 
==Censorship==
==Censorship==
Line 36: Line 33:
[[File:Ramy Essam.jpg|thumb|Ramy Essam]]
[[File:Ramy Essam.jpg|thumb|Ramy Essam]]
Ramy Essam, the 23-year-old Egyptian student and musician, was arrest and tortured by the army police on 9 March 2011.<ref name="CNN">{{cite web|author=By Â Reza Sayah, CNN |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/03/17/egypt.activists/index.html |title=Pro-democracy activists allege torture by Egyptian soldiers - CNN.com |publisher=Edition.cnn.com |date=18 March 2011 |accessdate=10 June 2011}}</ref> Without warning, the army stormed the [[Tahrir Square|square]], ripping down tents and arresting more than 100 people, including Ramy Essam.<ref name="NPR"/> He says men in army uniforms dragged him to the Egyptian National Museum, which had become a security headquarters.<ref name="NPR"/> He says the men took him to a courtyard, stripped him to his shorts, and started torturing Ramy Essam.<ref name="NPR"/> "They took off my clothes. They used sticks, metal rods, wires, whips." He received electric shocks, he said.<ref name="CNN"/> "There was a soldier who would jump in the air and land on my face with his legs".<ref name="CNN"/> Ramy Essam is best known as the singer of the Egyptian revolution due to his popular music during the Egyptian uprising against Hosni Mubarak.<ref name="NPR">{{cite web|url=http://www.npr.org/2011/03/15/134538629/ramy-esam-the-singer-of-the-egyptian-revolution |title=Ramy Essam: The Singer Of The Egyptian Revolution |publisher=NPR |date=15 March 2011 |accessdate=10 June 2011}}</ref>
Ramy Essam, the 23-year-old Egyptian student and musician, was arrest and tortured by the army police on 9 March 2011.<ref name="CNN">{{cite web|author=By Â Reza Sayah, CNN |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/03/17/egypt.activists/index.html |title=Pro-democracy activists allege torture by Egyptian soldiers - CNN.com |publisher=Edition.cnn.com |date=18 March 2011 |accessdate=10 June 2011}}</ref> Without warning, the army stormed the [[Tahrir Square|square]], ripping down tents and arresting more than 100 people, including Ramy Essam.<ref name="NPR"/> He says men in army uniforms dragged him to the Egyptian National Museum, which had become a security headquarters.<ref name="NPR"/> He says the men took him to a courtyard, stripped him to his shorts, and started torturing Ramy Essam.<ref name="NPR"/> "They took off my clothes. They used sticks, metal rods, wires, whips." He received electric shocks, he said.<ref name="CNN"/> "There was a soldier who would jump in the air and land on my face with his legs".<ref name="CNN"/> Ramy Essam is best known as the singer of the Egyptian revolution due to his popular music during the Egyptian uprising against Hosni Mubarak.<ref name="NPR">{{cite web|url=http://www.npr.org/2011/03/15/134538629/ramy-esam-the-singer-of-the-egyptian-revolution |title=Ramy Essam: The Singer Of The Egyptian Revolution |publisher=NPR |date=15 March 2011 |accessdate=10 June 2011}}</ref>
  +   +
==Murder==
  +
Ramy Fakhry,<ref name="ahram2"/> 27-year-old electrical engineer, was killed by the army.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/12289/Egypt/Politics-/Candlelight-vigil-for-Egyptian-shot-by-army-asks-W.aspx |title=Candlelight vigil for Egyptian shot by army asks 'Why was Ramy killed?' |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> He died as a result of bullet wounds received at an army checkpoint somewhere in the governorate of Damietta. The checkpointâs exact location is unknown.<ref name="thedailynewsegypt1">{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailynewsegypt.com/crime-a-accidents/family-of-man-killed-at-checkpoint-demands-investigation.html |title=Family of man killed at checkpoint demands investigation |publisher=www.thedailynewsegypt.com|date=2011-05-15 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> According to one, unconfirmed, version of events, Fakhry stopped his car just short of the checkpoint when he saw a gunfight between the army and assailants ahead of him and was shot three times in the back as he attempted to drive away.<ref name="thedailynewsegypt1"/> Another version of the story says he left the rig where he worked near Damietta on Friday 13 May to attend a wedding. On his way back later that night at 1am â before the curfew imposed at the time â Fakhry was shot dead at an army checkpoint.<ref name="ahram2">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/14715/Egypt/Politics-/Activists-and-friends-seek-answers-over-Ramy-Fakhr.aspx |title=Activists and friends seek answers over Ramy Fakhryâs death|publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-06-21 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> A candlelight vigil was organized by Ramy's family and friends on May 14th, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arabawy.org/2011/05/17/tribute-to-ramy-fakhry-%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%85%D9%8A-%D9%81%D8%AE%D8%B1%D9%8A/ |title=Tribute to Ramy Fakhry 3|publisher=www.arabawy.org|date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> Head of the Supreme Council for Armed Force (SCAF), Field Marshal Hussein Tantawi, ordered an investigation into the killing of Ramy Fakhry.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailynewsegypt.com/people/following-vigil-scaf-orders-investigation-into-army-shooting-of-engineer.html |title=Following vigil, SCAF orders investigation into army shooting of engineer |publisher=www.thedailynewsegypt.com|date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> The statement has not been followed with any updates concerning the investigation, prompting the call for action.<ref name="ahram2"/>
